items.synopsis: This is The Loop, your quick catch-up for this morning's stories as they happen.

title.children: Bus crash driver to face court today, and a man found dead in a backyard near Brisbane. Catch up with The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A homicide investigation has been launched after the death of a man in Logan, south of Brisbane. Police say they found the body of a 67-year-old man in the backyard of a home on Redwood Street in the suburb of Marsden early this morning, and arrested a 30-year-old man. A 60-year-old woman who was also home at the time was not hurt. Police say the three people are known to each other. Family and domestic violence support services: If you need help immediately call emergency services on triple-0 1800 Respect National Helpline : 1800 737 732 Women's Crisis Line : 1800 811 811 Men's Referral Service : 1300 766 491 Lifeline : 131 114 Relationships Australia : 1300 364 277
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Man found dead in backyard after alleged domestic violence incident south of Brisbane

children.content: A homicide investigation has been launched after the death of a man in Logan, south of Brisbane.
Police say
they found the body of a 67-year-old man in the backyard of a home
on Redwood Street in the suburb of Marsden early this morning, and arrested a 30-year-old man.
A 60-year-old woman who was also home at the time was not hurt.
Police say the three people are known to each other.
Family and domestic violence support services:
If you need help immediately call emergency services on triple-0
1800 Respect National Helpline
Women's Crisis Line
Men's Referral Service
Lifeline
Relationships Australia

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: US comedian and actor Marlon Wayans has had to cancel a show after a spat with a United Airlines employee over carry-on luggage. The Scary Movie star wrote on Instagram that a gate agent told him he had too many bags, and that he would have to check in his luggage rather than carry it on. Wayans, who says his treatment constitutes harassment, reportedly took his ticket, pushed past an employee and tried to board the plane from Denver to Kansas City. He booked a later flight, saying he would rather fly coach on another airline than fly first-class on United. He apologised to his fans in Kansas City for missing a performance. "Sorry KC I'm gonna miss tonight's shows due to a United gate agent who probably hated White Chicks," Wayans says on Twitter, referring to his 2004 movie which also starred his brother Shawn Wayans. Wayans must appear in court in Denver on July 11 on a citation of disturbing the peace.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Comedian Marlon Wayans cancels US show after airline spat

props.alt: A black man in a suit stands in front of a sign which reads 'Marlon'

children.content: (AP: Richard Shotwell/Invision)
US comedian and actor Marlon Wayans has had to cancel a show after a spat with a United Airlines employee over carry-on luggage.
The Scary Movie star wrote on Instagram that
a gate agent told him he had too many bags
, and that he would have to check in his luggage rather than carry it on.
Wayans, who says his treatment constitutes harassment, reportedly took his ticket, pushed past an employee and tried to board the plane from Denver to Kansas City.
He booked a later flight, saying he would rather fly coach on another airline than fly first-class on United.
He apologised to his fans in Kansas City
for missing a performance.
"Sorry KC I'm gonna miss tonight's shows due to a United gate agent who probably hated White Chicks," Wayans says on Twitter, referring to his 2004 movie which also starred his brother Shawn Wayans.
Wayans must appear in court in Denver on July 11 on a citation of disturbing the peace.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The driver of the bus involved in Sunday night's tragic crash in the New South Wales Hunter Valley region is expected to face court this morning. The 58-year-old man from Maitland is due to face court in Cessnock, charged with 10 counts of dangerous driving occasioning death — drive manner dangerous, and negligent driving (occasioning death). It comes as support is being offered to those impacted by the bus crash, in which 10 people were killed and more than 20 hospitalised. The local health district will open two drop-in clinics from this morning. One will open at the Singleton Youth Venue from 9am. The second will operate from 10am at the Branxton Community Centre for the Cessnock community. It will be staffed by disaster response and senior mental health clinicians, along with other services. We're also expecting to hear more from authorities about the crash at around 8am this morning .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: News Australia is searching for: Hunter Valley bus crash

props.alt: A large bus on its side next to a road, with skid marks and police nearby

children.content: (AAP: Darren Pateman)
The driver of the bus involved in Sunday night's tragic crash in the New South Wales Hunter Valley region is
expected to face court this morning
The 58-year-old man from Maitland is due to face court in Cessnock, charged with
10 counts of dangerous driving occasioning death — drive manner dangerous, and negligent driving (occasioning death)
It comes as support is being offered to those impacted by the bus crash, in which
10 people were killed and more than 20 hospitalised
